[ Laud MS. 622, leaf 69, back .] SO mychel wisdom neuer y-herd was; as kyng salamon couþe: Vche word wyt & wisdom was; þat com out of his mouþe. Þe kynde he couþe of vche beest; & of vche quik þing, And þe vertu of vche herbe; þat doþ on erþe spr[i]nge; And þorou&yogh; queintise in book ywrite; þe fende to ouer-come, Þat þise clerkes &yogh;utt to þis day; in priuete habbeþ some. A Book he made of wisdom; þorou&yogh; his owen þou&yogh;th; Sum ich wil þerof telle; for al ne may I nou&yogh;th. Þe book bigan in þis manere; euerich wyt & wisdom, Euer with oure lord it is; & fro hym first it com. Who schulde þe rein-dropes telle; oiþer þe grauel in þe Cee, Oiþer þe dayes þat euere were; bot &yogh;if it were he? To douten god almi&yogh;tty; of vche wisdom it is rote. On erþe & at þine endyngday; of alle bales he is bote. &YOGH;if þou louest wisdom; look þou ri&yogh;th loue; Vnbuxum ne be þou nou&yogh;th; to þem þat ben þe aboue. Helpe þe man þat nedeful is; be a&yogh;eins hym þat is vnmylde. Be þou merciable to widewe; & to faderles childe. Ne hide nou&yogh;th þi wisdom; ne wiþseie nou&yogh;th þe ri&yogh;th. A&yogh;ein stronge men & ireful; look þat þou ne fi&yogh;th. Answere þe pouere myldelich; to longe abid þou nou&yogh;th Forto turne a&yogh;ein to god; &yogh;if þou be in synne brou&yogh;th. // Ne bileue þou nou&yogh;th to trauaile; oiþer to deþ[e] fi&yogh;th, For Iesu cristes swete loue; to susteyne þe ri&yogh;th. Wiþ þe fole ne wone þou nou&yogh;th; &yogh;if þou wilt good lerne. Þou wisse hym þat litel good can; þe vnwise teche &yogh;erne. Ne wilne nou&yogh;th Iustise to be; bot &yogh;if þou cunne & mowe. Þe vnbuxum, chastise wiþ ri&yogh;th law&yogh;e; & make þe proude abou&yogh;e. Þei&yogh; þou haue a .M. frendes; take on þat be good & priuee, Þat þou mowe þi conseil telle; lest þe oþer failen þe. For summe ben at þi borde þi frende; ac at þi nede bihynde. Best tresore is þine elde frende; þat men on erþe may fynde; Þi trewe frende emforþ þi-self; þou mi&yogh;th telle þi þou&yogh;th; Michel solas he wil þe don; &yogh;if þou art in baret brou&yogh;th. ¶ To Newfangel ne be þou nou&yogh;th; lest þou finde vntrewe. Þine olde frende þat þou fonded haste; bileue þou for no newe. Faire speche is [ful] good þing; it passeþ many fon, And makeþ many a good frend; & holdeþ hol many a bon. Chese þe a witty hyne; & loue hym with al þi mi&yogh;th; Of his Salerie wiþholde þou nou&yogh;th; þat þou schalt hym with ri&yogh;th. Þerwhile þi sones &yogh;onge beþ; þou hem chastise & lere; Wite þi douttren with eye wel; þat þai haue of þe fere; Selde þou make hem fair semblaunt; þer while þai ben þe mytte; Whan þai schullen ywedded be; take hem a man of wytte. // Honoure fader & moder; þat þe in-to þis werlde brou&yogh;th; Þe pyne þat þi moder had; haue it mychel in þou&yogh;th. Who so honoureþ fader & moder; þe lenger he worþe alyue; His hous & al his erþlich þing; þe better schal yþriue. To þe seke gladlich þou go; þan doostou as þe kynde. In euerych dede þat þou doost; þine endynge haue in mynde. ¶ Ne chide nou&yogh;th wiþ no foule speker; with riche ne plede þou no&yogh;t; For oft þe ri&yogh;th, þorou&yogh; gret mede; is in-to wrong y-brou&yogh;th. Mid a fole, of þi þing; ne make þou non In mone. Wiþ a Man þat fool-hardy is; ne goo þou nou&yogh;th alone. To fool ne to non vncouþ man; þi conseil [þou] ne telle, For þe fool, bot his foly; noþing ne loueþ wel. Ne biholde no faire wymmen; þat þai ne chaunge þi þou&yogh;t; Ne loue no womman with þine hert; þat sche ne gile þe nou&yogh;t; Ne biholde nou&yogh;th in þe strete; aboute fram þing to þing. &YOGH;if a liþer man doþ þe vnri&yogh;th; ne haue þerof no likyng. Dele þi frendes & pouere men; þi good by þi daye; Ne bileue it nou&yogh;th to oþer men; lest þai þe bitraye. Ne delite þe nou&yogh;th to gete children; many & vnmylde, ffor &yogh;ut þe were better; to deye wiþouten childe. ¶ Amended is al a cuntre; wiþ a Man þat is wys. And for a liþer man; mychel enpaired I-wis. A riche werk of dronkelew man; selde is yfounde, For Tauerne & leccherie; many man bringeþ to grounde Noiþer þi frende ne þi foo; ne telle þou þi priuete; For bot he be þe better frend; &yogh;if he wot any yuel by þe Þat þou ne most þe more hym bow&yogh;e; &yogh;if þou misseist hym ou&yogh;t, Þat yuel þat he wot by þe; he nyll it hele nou&yogh;th. Vndernyme þi frend; &yogh;if þou seest hym mysdo; &YOGH;if he is a fool or þi foo; ne do þou nou&yogh;th so. Riche &yogh;iftes & present&yogh;; maken þise Iuges blynde, Þat þai cunnen yse þe ri&yogh;th; þe wrong sone þai fynde. // wisdom yheled, litel is worþ; oiþer treuþ ihyd; Bot boþe þai wexen swiþe; &yogh;if þai ben y-kyd. Good is, wisdom to schewe; & to hely folie; For þe fool ne can hele noþing; bot he it out wrie; His hert is as a vessel; þat boþome ne haþ non; Whan any þing þerinne comeþ; it goþ out onon. A fool, men mowen wel yknowe; for oft he goþ aboute With erandes to many hous; & oft he stant withoute, And goþ to a windowe stillelich; & soft lokeþ þer-inne, Oiþer herkneþ þerat what men; seien þere wiþinne. Sone & lovde he wil li&yogh;e; whan he hereþ foly telle: A wise man wolde aschamed be; &yogh;if swich a cas hym bifelle. Vche word þat at his mouþe schal come, schal be by mesure; Hym is loþ to telle myche; ac leue myche to here. &YOGH;ut þre wisdoms lerne of me; ne þenche nou&yogh;th to longe; Be nou&yogh;th sory for no los; ne after noþing longe, Namelich þat þou ne mi&yogh;th nou&yogh;th haue; ne nou&yogh;th þerfore ne care. Ne al þat þou herest, ne leue þou nou&yogh;th; &yogh;if þou wilt wel fare. An vntau&yogh;t childe his fader schent more; þan þei hem selue don; Þe man þat techeþ his children wel; sore saweþ his fon. Þre þinges on erþe beþ; þat men mowen nou&yogh;th y-knowe: Whiche hij ben, I schal &yogh;ou telle; boþe to hei&yogh;e & lowe: Þe fissches weie in þe Cee; þe snakes weie on erþe, And þe foules waie in þe sky; þe werst is þe fierþe: Þat is, childes waie in his &yogh;ouþe; &yogh;if it haþ his wille. For many a foule waie it will goo; & selde sitt stille. Þis book made Salamon; of þise wisdoms & more: To mychel he loued leccherie; for al his wise lore, Seuenty wyues in spousehode; he helde al his lyf, And þre hundreþ in leccherie; þat non þerof was his wyf. Fourty wyntren he was kyng; & died in þe fourtide &yogh;ere. Telle men mi&yogh;tten þat he were saf; &yogh;if leccherie nere. Foure hundreþ &yogh;er & seuentene; it was þo he died, & mo, Þat þe folk of Israel; out of Egipte gunnen go. Affter kyng Salomons deþ; Roboam his sone Was of þat londe kyng ymade; as it was þe wone. Þat folk cried on hym a day; þat he a-legge scholde Þe seruage þat his fader hem made; þe better serue hym þai wolde. Þerfore with alle his olde men; þe kyng went to conseile: Þai radden hym mylde forto be; þe more it wolde hym availe. He cleped forþ his &yogh;onge folk; as he hym self was, & axed wheþer þe reed was good; þai seiden þat it nas; Bot "be þou sterne & dredeful; & þan wil þai ben good; Ne schaltou hem neuere good holde; bot with sterne mood." ¶ Þe kyng þis conseil loued wel; his bondemen he lete fecche. "Wene &yogh;e for my fader was wys; þat ich wil be a wrecche. In þe left fynger þat ich haue; strengþe þere is more Þan was in al my fader schulder; for al his wise lore &yogh;if he &yogh;ou brou&yogh;th in seruage; to more I wil &yogh;ou drawe. Wene &yogh;e þei&yogh; ich be &yogh;ong; þat ich ne couþe &yogh;ou lawe?" Þis folk crieden &yogh;erne & wepen; sore þai hem dradd; Ac for noþing þai mi&yogh;tten do; oþer word þai nadd. ÞO þai weren from hym ywent; gret conseil þai token. Þe ten kyndes of israel; for kyng þai hym forsoken, And made hem a newe kyng; ne stode hem of hym non eie; ffor þere ne leued wiþ hym; bot þe kyndes tweie, Bot þe kynde of Beniamyn; & þe kynde of Iudas; Alle þe kyndes of þe oþer ten; a&yogh;eins hym fast was. Þe kyng sent messagers to hem; & gret doel to hym he nom; Wiþ stones þai slow&yogh;en his messagers; þat to hem from hym com. Affter þai maden Ieroboam kyng; wel he gan hem paie; And euere þe kyngdom departed is &yogh;ut to þis daye. Þe kyngdom of þe tweie kyndes; Iudee ycleped is; Þerinne oure lord was ybore; in Bethleem iwis. Þe kyngdom of þe ten kyndes; ycleped is israel; Þere mi&yogh;th Roboam þe kyng; acursy fole conseil. Ofte eye & pride, harme doeþ; þere men mi&yogh;th yse; So riche a man in londe nis; þat mowe al-one be; So riche a kyng in þe werlde nys; þat poure begger he nere, ffor al þe richesse þat he haþ; &yogh;if vche man his fo were. IT bifel in israel; by þe kyngesday, swiche a cas: Þere was a wise prophete; Elye ycleped he was. In wildernesse he woned; þe good prophete Elye, ffor þe kyng awaited hym to sle; for his prophecie. A morewen & an euen a Rauen; þere com vche a day, And brou&yogh;th þe prophete mete; in wildernesse þere he lay. Siþen as oure lorde hym hete; to a toun he wende, And sei&yogh; a widewe gadre wood; onon to hir he kende. Þere he woned longe wiþ hire; a day þer fel a cas Þat þe widewe son died; he was yhote Ionas; Elie arered hym fram deþ to lyue; þorou&yogh; goddes sonde; And siþen he was a prophete; þe wisest in þe londe. ffor wel longe afterward; oure lord bad Ionas gon To þe Cite of Niniue; þat schulde haue ben fordon ffor synne þat þai hadden ydon; Ionas was adradd, Ac forto prechen þider he &yogh;ede; as oure lord hym bad. // To þe hil of Oreb; Ely redy wende Þere Moyses in þe brennyng þorne; oure lorde kende: ffourty dayes he was þiderward; þat he ne ete ne dronk As it goddes will was; he had mychel þonk. Þere oure lorde spak wiþ hym; & hete hym good lyf lede, And wende a&yogh;ein to israel; & noþing ne drede. "// A Man þat hatte Elisee; by þe waie þou schalt fynde; Þou schalt hym take forþ wiþ þe; þat he ne leue bihynde." Elie þe prophete went forþ; til he in-to desert cam. He fonde Elyse gon on þe pleyn; with hym forþ he hym nam To þe londe of israel MS. isrk. ; þai nadden of þe kyng non eye. Elise fonde anoþer prophete; & þider þai wenten beie. Þo lay þe kyng sore seek; & þo it was hym ysed, Elye tolde his messagers; þat he schulde be ded. He hete his men wende after hym; þat þai sparen ne scholde; He wende, &yogh;if he mi&yogh;th hym haue hadd; þat he hym hele wolde. Þei wenten forþ & comen to Elye; "goddes man" þai seide: "Þe kyng hete þe come & speke with hym; &yogh;if þou couþest hym rede." Elie seide "&yogh;if ich am goddes man; I. bid god al-one, Þat wilde fire come fram heuen adoun; & brenne &yogh;ou vchone." Amyd þis word onon; fire fram heuen com, And brent þise men al to dust; þere was an hard dom. Sore alonged was þe kyng; after hym ylome; Tueie he sent of oþer men; þo þai nou&yogh;[th] ne come. Þai seiden as þe oþer deden; þo þai Elye seie; And as þe oþer þai weren serued; ibrou&yogh;th on li&yogh;th leie. þo þai ne comen nou&yogh;th a&yogh;ein; þe kyng þou&yogh;th longe, And lete sende after hym; wise men & stronge. // &YOGH;erne þai crieden mercie; þo þai Elye sei&yogh;e: "Haue mercy on þe kyng; or elles he schal di&yogh;e." Þerof seide Elye; "Siker he may be. Ac, forto paye his corage; ich wil hym ones see." Elye went forþ to þe kyng; & seide he schulde be ded; And sone he died þerafter-ward; as he had ysed. Elie & Elisee in þe londe; wide aboute went, For to tellen of prophecie; as oure lorde hem sent. As þai precheden goddes lawe; from heuen þere ali&yogh;th A fyry hors & a cart;—boþe þai weren wel bri&yogh;th;— Elye þerinne went; þat hors hym drou&yogh; vp on hei&yogh; In þe cart to heuen; þat men neuer eft hym ne sei&yogh;. // Ri&yogh;th to heuen ne segge ich nou&yogh;th; þat he euer come, For he schal haue fleschlich lyf; forto a&yogh;eins þe day of dome. We rede nou&yogh;th bot of two Men; þat hennes alyue went, Enok & Elye; as god hem after sent. Boþe þai wonen in paradys; & boþe þai schullen ali&yogh;th A&yogh;eins þe day of dome; & wiþ antecrist fi&yogh;th. Anticrist hem schal boþe sle; & siþþen þai schullen wende To þe blisse of heuen; & wonen þere wiþouten ende. ÞO Ely in þis fair cart; to heuen was ylad, Elye Elisee his felawe; was sory, & nou&yogh;th glad. He &yogh;ede to don his prophecie; in þe londe of Ierico: Þere he fonde a liþer welle; þat many man dude wo, ffor it wolde wex & sprede; wide & brode ilome, Ne mi&yogh;th þe erþe bere no fruyt; þere þe water come. Þe prophete blissed salt; & in þe watere cast; Þe liþerhede þat þerinne was; mi&yogh;th no lengere last; It bicom þe best watere; þat euer mi&yogh;th ben; Al þat it comeþ-nei&yogh;; þe bettere schal þeen. ffor þe miracle þat men þo say; þat white salt had ydo, Whan þe preest makeþ haliwater; salt he doþ þerto. A Womman cried on Elisee; as sche hym mette, Eliseus & seide, men took al hir good; for hire hosebonde dette, & þat sche nadd nomore good; bot Oile alite. Elisee bad hire take þerof; & in vche vessel it pite Þat sche had in al hire hous; & þo sche had ydo þis, Euerich vessel was ful; of good oyle Iwis. Þis womman had þer þorou&yogh;; ynou&yogh; of al good fforto &yogh;elde her dettes; & to hire lyues food. It bifel þat men of Babiloyne; weren of liþer bileue: Þai honoureden a fals god; a morewe & ek an eue. A Wise prophete was in þat londe; þat hi&yogh;th Danyel. ¶Danyel. He com & told þe kyng 'fore; his men bileueden no&yogh;t wel. &YOGH;iue me power ouer hem; & ich hem wil bringe of dawe.' Þan seide þe kyng to hym; "þat were no wise lawe." Þat folk þo þai herden þis; þe kyng þai comen to: "&YOGH;iue vs" þai seiden "Danyel; oure will with hym to do, Oiþer we schullen þe sle; er we hennes gon." Þe kyng was of hem sore adrad; & graunted hem onon. Onon þai token Danyel þo; & casten hym in-to a pytte, Þere seuen hungri lyouns weren; þereinne all ydytte, ffor þai hym strangli scholden; ac þai deden hym non harme; Bot whan þat he was sett adoun; þai leneden in-to his barme. A Man þere was þat hi&yogh;th Abacuc; in-to þe felde he went, ¶ Abacuk. Repmen forto bere mete; sone he hym þider sent. Þe Aungel hym bad abide; & to Danyel it bere. Sone he seide 'he nolde'; & &yogh;af hym li&yogh;th ansuere. Þe aungel took hym by þe top; & bare hym forþ þer myde,— Hym had ben bettere to haue ygo; þan so fer to haue iryde,— & so hym he bare to Danyel; & þo he com hym to, He &yogh;af hym þe mete þat he bare; & lete Abacuc go. Þo Danyel had seueni&yogh;th; ibe in þe dep pytt, Þe kyng loked to his lyouns; & lete hem vndytt. ¶ Alyue he fond Danyel; gret wonder he hadde. Wiþ gret ioye he took hym vp; & to his fon hym lad. Þe men þat brou&yogh;tten hym þere; he lete nyme fast, And euerych after oþere; amonge þe lyouns cast. Sone hadden þe Lyouns; forswelewed hem vchone; And so oure lorde euer among; takeþ wreche of his fon. Þapostles, forto þai weren yslawe; precheden cristendom; And many man after hem; good prechour bycom. And now þise freres don also; prechen aboute ylome, ffor of prechyng it worþe nede; er þe day of dome. ÞE first signe þer a&yogh;eins; as oure lord hym-self sede, Hungere schal on erþe be; treccherie & falshede, Batailes & litel loue; sekenesse & haterede; & þe erþe schal quaken; þat vche man schal drede; Þe mone schal turne to blood; þe sunne to derkhede; Antecrist schal on erþe gon; & prechen his li er hede. He schal go bot in þe holy londe; þere oure lord &yogh;ede, & his deciples in-to al þe werlde; his yuel wordes wil bede. As þai speken, þai schullen do; miracles grete & ryue; Bot we ne fynde nou&yogh;th þai mowe; arere þe ded to lyue. Bot in-to cursed gostes; fendes willeþ go, fforto bere hem witnesse; of al þat he seiþ hem to. Þise grete clerkes & wise; a&yogh;ein hym schullen speke, fforto holden vp cristendom; þat men it nou&yogh;th ne breke. Bot many of þise foles siggen; in her hastite, Þat clerkes schullen fordo þis werld; bot so schal it no&yogh;t be, Bot þe fals clergie; þat antecrist schal of preche; & fele þat in godenesse schulden be; liþer he wil hem teche. Ac so wys clerk ne worþ þer non; þat ne schal haue to don ynou&yogh; fforto disputen a&yogh;eins hym; þei&yogh; he haue þe wou&yogh;. Many men schullen turne; to yuel, men may drede, ffor on erþe men may se; to liþer, stedfast hede. Oure lord let hym on erþe gon; for þat he wil fonde Whiche men of stedfastnesse beþ; & cristendom vnderstonde. Tueie men ben in paradys; Enok & Elye; Þai ne suffreden neuer deþ; as we han seid twie. A&yogh;eins þe day of dome; þai schullen on erþe ali&yogh;th, And her eiþer after oþer; a&yogh;eins Antecrist fi&yogh;th. Anticrist hem schal boþe sle; & fele Men willen þerfore Turne to her bileue; & make her soules forlore. Atte last schal come þe holi gost; in fourme of swerd al[i]&yogh;t, & Anticrist to deþ smyte; þorou&yogh; his swete mi&yogh;t.

Þat oþer dai, it schal so lowe ali&yogh;t; þat vnneþe men schul it se; Alle þe fissches þe þrid day; abouen þe water schull be, & so reuly a cri &yogh;iuen; þat all men schullen haue fere; Þe fierþe day, water schal brenne; as þei&yogh; it coles were; Þe v te . day, schal euerych tre; blede dropes of blood; Þe vj te . day, schull castels & houses fall; all þat euer stood; Þe vij te . day, stones schull fi&yogh;tt; þe viij. þe erþe quake; Þe ix e day, all hilles spreden abrod; & al þe werld euen make; Þe x. day, men schul renne aboute; as þai wode were, As wilde bestes holes to seche; to hide hem inne for fere. // Þe xj. day, bones of ded men; arisen schull & vpri&yogh;t stonde; Þe xij dai, as þei&yogh; it steren weren; fram heuen to þe londe; Þe xiij. dai, vche quik þing schal dye; þe xiiij. fire ali&yogh;t, And brenne al þe middelerd; so crist it wil di&yogh;t; Þe xv. dai, schollen .iiij. Aungels comen; a .iiij. half mydlerde, & blowen þorou&yogh;-out al þe werlde; þat vche man schal be aferd; ffor in þilk age he schal arise; þat god was inne ded, Of litel more þan .xxx ti . wyntren; as ich &yogh;ou habbe ised,

1.0: ¶ Lamentacio animarum. [ This is the Head line in the MS, tho' there is no break in the story. ]
1.1: Wiþ þilk body þat he had here; he ne schal so litel misse As þe lest her of his body; I sigge &yogh;ou Iwisse. Oure lord schal come & smyte adoun; as li&yogh;ttyng doþ to ground, Þere þat he to heuen sti&yogh;e; with his bledyng wounde. MS. woudē An Aungel schal þe spere & þe nails; & þe crovne of þorn, & þe rood þat he died on; with hym bringe aforn. In þe vale of Iosephat; his dom he wil do; Þe best man schal sore agrise; þat schal come þerto. Leuere had his owen moder; in helle pyne to be, Al þe while þe dom ylast; þan her sones face to see. Allas! hou schull we þan ouercome; þilk griselich fere, Whan vche seint schal aferde be; oure lord crist to see þere?
1.2: OVre lord wil schewe his bitter woundes; And Sigge, "Man! for þe, Look what ich haue ysuffred; what hastow suffred for me?" Mest he wil vnderstonde þere; þe vij. merciful dedes: Who þat haþ hem here ydo; as he with his mouþ sede, Þe hungri forto fede; & schride þe cloþles, Ofte goo to sek men; & herberewe þe housles, Þe dede forto bury,; þe bounden to vnbynde, Þai þat þise on erþe loueden; þere hij schullen it fynde.
1.3: OVre lord wil to þe liþer sigge; as we reden in gospelle, "&yogh;e cursed gostes, goþ; in-to þe pyne of helle!" Þe deuelen willen come &yogh;ernend; & speten fire & blast, & taken þe wrecched soulen; & in-to pyne hem cast.
1.4: OVre lord wil to good men sigge; "in my ri&yogh;th honde &yogh;e come, And afongeþ my fador riche; þat a&yogh;eins &yogh;ow is ynome, Þat to &yogh;ou was ymaked; bifore þe werldes biginnyng; Þere &yogh;e schullen be in ioye with me; wiþ-outen any endyng." In þis book we finde ywrite; þat þre manere folk schal saued be, Maidenhod & spousehod; & widewehode: þise þre. Ich bid hym þat vs deme schal; kyng of all kynge, Among his blissed sones; oure soules to heuen brynge. Amen.
1.5: Off ioye & blisse is my song; care to bileue, & to herie hym among; þat al oure sorou&yogh; schal reue. Ycome he is, þat swete dew; þat swete hony drope, Iesus, kynge of alle kynges; to whom is al oure hope. Bicome he is oure broþer; whare was he so longe; He it is, & non oþer; þat bou&yogh;th vs so stronge. Oure broþer we mowe hym clepe wel; so seiþ hym-self ilome, & so ne mi&yogh;tten þai neuer adel; þat bifore vs come. He nas oure broþer nou&yogh;th; er he oure flesch nome; Þerwiþ he haþ vs dere abou&yogh;th; to maken vs ysome. ysome nere we nou&yogh;th bifore; Aungels & oure kynde, Er swete Iesus were ybore; þat to selde is in mynde. // Bot now he haþ oure flesch ynome; & oure broþer is; Oure kynde is wel hei&yogh;e ycome; among oþer, Iwis; ffor he is oure kynde heixt; saue his godhede, & al aboue his throne next; so hei&yogh;e is manhede. Aungel ne worþ hym nou&yogh;t so nei&yogh;; for he is oure broþer nou&yogh;th, & þat oure kynde is ek so hei&yogh;e; he haþ vs dere abou&yogh;th. Aungels he ne bou&yogh;th nou&yogh;th; we ben hym wel neer; Whan he haþ vs so dere bou&yogh;th; wel ou&yogh;tten we to louen hym here. Ne aungel nys naþemo; bot his messagere, How mi&yogh;th it þan go; to be his broþer here? & in heuen þai schullen also; whan þat we ben þere, Oure hestes & oure will do; as þai oure hynen were, And to oure heste seruen vs; to foot & to honde, Oure owen mowe we holden hem; as ich vnderstonde; wel mowe we þan glade be; to habbe suich an hyne. & siþþe we mowe here isee; as we iseþ atte fyne, Þat we ben alþer kynde hei&yogh;est; wiþ-oute god al-one, And in heuen also hym next; among his aungels vchone. And all þat now late comen; siþ oure lorde ali&yogh;th, And oure flesch haþ here ynomen; yheried be his mi&yogh;th! Þilk þat toforne vs come; whan þai þe deþ founde, Þan were þai onon ycast; in-to helle grounde. Nere he neuer so holy ne so good; þere nas non forbore; And so hem longed sore; after oure lorde þerfore. // Þe prophetes þat weren so good; & so holy alle, Þat of oure lorde vnderstoden; & what schulde bi-fall, Hij wisten þat he schulde come; ac hij nysten whanne; Þe tyme hem þou&yogh;t long ynou&yogh;; vche ynche hem þou&yogh;t a spanne. Þai gradden after hym oft; in her prophecie, And in þe bokes þat þai writen; þat he schulde dye: "God &yogh;eue," quoþ on of hem; "þat heuen broste atwo, Þat he mi&yogh;th ali&yogh;th adoun; & vs sauen so." Sumdel hem longed þo; whan þai nolden abide, Þat heuen cleue soft a two; to saue vche side. Ac it schulde al to brest; & oure lorde falle adoune, Mi&yogh;th þai hym haue yhent; fast by þe crovne. Ac he ne hei&yogh;ed nou&yogh;th so swiþ; bot com soft adoun; Þai wolde hym narew&yogh; hab y-hent; ac he held hem þer doun. Parde, &yogh;it ne com he nou&yogh;th; ne were hem neuer so wo; Þai hadden þe grounde of helle isou&yogh;th; er he com hem to. Seint Dauid after his anoie; after hym grad þus: "Lord, in heuen to vs abow&yogh;e; & ali&yogh;th to vs! Schewe vs þine holy face; & we worþe hool onon." Hym longed ek after his face; þe holy Symeon, And all blis hym was bynome; & oft he gradd þerfore: "Lorde, whan wiltou come; & wilt ben ybore? Wene &yogh;e ich may dure; wene &yogh;e ich may see?" Her mone was doel to see; þere gamed hem no gle. // Ac hym ne greued nou&yogh;th; a&yogh;eins oþer bifore, ffor he nas nou&yogh;th to deþ ibrou&yogh;th; er god were ibore, Ac liued forto he hym sei&yogh;; & in his armes nome, Þo he on Candelmesday; to þe temple come. Lorde, wel may vs be; bet þan hem was þo, Þat ne mi&yogh;tten nower fle; lorde, what hem was wo. Þere oure lorde seide; þo he was ybore, Þat we mi&yogh;tten ben ful glade; ouer oþer þat weren bifore. Þe prophetes wilned hym forto see; & many kynges also, Þat we isen &yogh;if it mi&yogh;th be; ac hij ne mi&yogh;tten it nou&yogh;th do. // we mowen now as it were; for nou&yogh;th, to heuen come, Siþþen oure lord it had ibou&yogh;th; & þe fendes power bynome. Ac þai þat suich grace ne hadden; þat tofore vs come, After oure lorde þai gradden; in þe prophecie ylome; After hym þai gradden; wiþ gret wille & longe; No mendement þai ne seie; bot gret pyne & stronge; So longe þat þai wery weren; & leten be al stille, And he[r] gredyng forberen; & turneden to goddes wille; ffor þai ne sei&yogh;en non oþer won; þou&yogh; hem þou&yogh;tten longe; Oure lorde lete her will ago; er he wolde flesch a-fonge. And þo þai weren wery ynou&yogh;; as who seiþ for sore, Vche of hem to rest drou&yogh;; & speken of hym nomore, Þat swete barne oure kynde took; boþe of flesche & felle, In whiche he dyed on rood; þe fendes strengþe to felle. Þorou&yogh; whiche preciouse deþ; god vs grant þat grace Þat we mowe after oure deþ; in heuen haue a place. Amen.

text.4: SOLOMON'S CORONATION, DEEDS, AND JUDGMENT ON THE TWO MOTHERS' CLAIM TO ONE CHILD. HIS COURT AND TEMPLE. [In order to complete the Life of Solomon, of which his Book of Wisdom , &c., form part, I add the MS. bit that comes before the Book . The passage about his birth is too far back to be taken.] [ Laud MS. 622, leaf 69, col . 1.] ¶ Þo Dauid in elde was; his eldest son was alyue. Adonye ycleped he was; with Salamon he gan striue. Aboute he was kyng to be; by his fader daye. Gret feste he made on a day; þat folk to paye. He ne bad nowgth þider Salamon; ne his moder þe quene; Þerfore sche was with hym wroþ; for wymmen beþ oft kene. "Sir," sche seide to Dauid; "oft þou swore me, Þat my son Salamon; schulde be kyng after þe. Now haþ Adonye iþou&yogh;th to be kyng bi þi lyue; & after þi day to sle my son; for þai ne ben by on wyue." ÞE kyng lete somony all his men: a fest he made sone, And lete coroone Salamon; & sette hym in his throne. By his lyue he made hym kyng; & bigan to prechi fast fforto sustene vp goddes law&yogh;e; þer-while his lif ylast; Þat he bulde forþ goddes hous in Ierusalems burgh&yogh;, Þat þe law&yogh;es better weren; ysustened þorou&yogh; & þorou&yogh;. Dauid was kyng fourty wyntren; in werre & in strife; And in þe fourtide &yogh;er; in pes he ended his lyf. Afftere his fader, Salamon; slou&yogh; his broþer Adonye In þe first &yogh;er, & all þat with hym weren; to hym he made boweye, & he wex faiþful man & wis; þat folk better to wisse, Þe kynges dou&yogh;ttere of Egipte; he wedded in gret blisse. Þe grete þinges forto don; he destred [? desired] goddes grace, fforto arere goddes temple; in on faire place, And aboute Ierusalem; treble wal arere. Þat to his bihofþe & vche riche kyng; þe court arered were, His sacrifise he dude to god; & gan to hym crie: "Lorde!" he seide, "to &yogh;ong icham; to haue suich maistrie. Teche me, &yogh;if þi wille be; wel my folk to wisse, And to knowe god & yuel; þat I þerof ne mysse." Oure lord hym graunted þinges þre; to haue maistri ouer his fo, To habbe worldes richesse ynou&yogh;; & wisdom ynou&yogh; þerto. IT bifel þat two wymmen; in on In, a ni&yogh;th were; Eiþer had a &yogh;ong childe; boþe of on &yogh;ere. In hire slep þat o womman; her owen childe ouerlay, And siþþe leide it by her felawe; & hir child nom away. Þo þe womman awook; & vnder&yogh;at þis gile, &YOGH;erne þai striueden & chid · for þe quik child a long while. Þat on seide, þe quyk childe was hire; þat oþer seide it nas. Boþe þei comen bifore þe kyng; & tolden al her cas. ¶ Þo þe kyng ne mi&yogh;th vnder&yogh;ete; wheþer had þe ri&yogh;th, "Take hider," he seide, "my swerd; & euen, I wil it di&yogh;th; Cleuen ich wil, &yogh;if ich can; þe quyk childe a two. & taken eiþer of &yogh;ou þe haluendel; whan &yogh;e nyllen oþer do." "&YOGH;e, sir," seide þe fals quene; "crist it &yogh;elde þe; So þou mi&yogh;th best legge strif; þan mowe we euen be." "Nay, sir," seide þe ri&yogh;th moder; "mercy, þat do þou nou&yogh;th! Take hire raþer euerich del; þat it ne be to deþ ybrou&yogh;th." "&YOGH;e, good womman," þe kyng seide; "take þat child to þe; ffor þou hast þe ri&yogh;th weye; & þe oþere þe falste." MIchel wonder hadden al þat folk · þat herden of þis strif, Þat þe kyng þou&yogh;th swich wisdom; in his &yogh;ong lyf. Men douteden þerafter-ward hym þe more; for þilk cas. Good pais þere was in hil londe; þer while he kyng was. Vche weke he spended in his hous; xxx. quarters of whete, And an hundreþ fatte weþers; & xxx. Oxen grete, Wiþouten venison & oþer þing; þat he had by deinte: In þe werlde was non so riche court; ne of so gret plente. He arered treble wal; swiþe fair & strong Aboute þe burgh&yogh; of Ierusalem; swiþe fair & long. Þe fierþe &yogh;er of his regne; he gan his temple arere, & in þe elleuenþe &yogh;er was it; er it redy were.
